cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 85 mi SSW of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Slowly drifting west, then turning northwest and north toward the central Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast near the Intracoastal City–Morgan City area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Mouth of the Mississippi River to Grand Isle and Intracoastal City to Cameron. Tropical Storm Watch: east of the Mouth of the Pearl River to the Mississippi/Alabama border.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Intracoastal City to Grand Isle. Tropical Storm Warning: Mouth of the Pearl River to Grand Isle, Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas (incl. New Orleans), Intracoastal City to Cameron.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and southeastern Louisiana coastline and adjacent Mississippi/Alabama coast
weather_observation.wind: Low (8%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds, mainly Saturday into early Sunday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the upper Texas coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Scattered outer rainbands could drop 1–3 inches of rain
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated surf and rip-current risk along the upper Texas coast
